result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip Edward Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 22CM133 and sentence currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay court costs through DOC.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such mental health treatment as DOC deems appropriate.
Defendant shall have such counseling as DOC deems appropriate.
Defendant shall take all prescribed medications as prescribed.
Defendant shall submit to random drug testing.
Defendant shall be employed full time or seek work at a rate of 3 job applications per week.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip Edward Robinson

records.addlTxt: August 31, 2022 - Sentencing Hearing - Partial Transcript - Judge's Sentence

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Phillip Edward Robinson appeared by video, in custody of Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Phillip Edward Robinson.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant to plead to charges. State will remain silent. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant pleads guilty. Defendant waives personal appearance. State heard on prior convictions. Kristina Steiner heard. Attorney Mickelson heard and recommends WSPS 4 or 5 years with one year confinement, concurrent. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders WSPS 4 years (1 & 3) with court costs, counseling, take prescribed medications, random drug testing, full time work or 3 applications per week, DNA. Credit of 76 days on 22CF139 and 56 days on 22CM133. Restitution of $1605 ordered on 22CM133. Sentences concurrent with each other and current sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant appeared by video in custody. ADA Anthony Pozorski in court. Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for defendant. Trial date to be rescheduled per letter from State so lab has more time. One day requested. Court sets status and trial date.
Status conference on August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's request for continued trial date
Status conference on August 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Phillip Edward Robinson did not appear.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Phillip Edward Robinson. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. DNA to be tested so trial date needed. Information filed. State clarifies penalties on information. Second paragraph should be disregarded. Defendant appears late by video from Grant County Jail. Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives right to preliminary hearing. Defendant waives reading and pleads not guilty. Attorney Mickelson advises court defendant no long demands speedy trial. If needed, a motion for speedy trial will be filed. Defendant advises court that he is not waiving right to speedy trial. Court sets status and jury trial.
Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury selection scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Phillip Edward Robinson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests $5000 cash bond with condition not to have contact with resident or property of victim. Defendant heard. Court sets $5000 cash bond with no contact with occupant of property or property. Defendant does not waive preliminary hearing time limits. Court sets bond at $5000 cash with no contact with property or occupant of property; contact SPD now. Preliminary hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
